Does anybody know any base assembly tips? I tried a assembly rover but it didn't work. Please help.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-04-01T14:08:28Z" title="04/01/2015 02:08  PM" data-short="9 yr">April 1, 2015</time> by Voyager275**
Seriously, almost every topic on KSP has a youtube video...go there and search, I promise you will find your answer.

Take a look at the stock rover with skycrane.

Take a look in the threads here.

Use RoveMate, put cubic strut in front / back. Position the wheels on the struts.

Try and error :-) It's the game...

if you are working with really low gravity planets ( minmus ) you can assemble it in orbit then just float to the ground.

if your working with kerbin type gravity you will have to have them on wheels on them assemble it in its entry then deploy the landing legs for a long term stay.

i dont do bases much so thats all i can throw at you now.

- Put everything on wheels. This especially if you're building a stock base (minimal or no mods).
- Build the attachment points identically.
- You can build a common scaffolding for your base parts which will ensure that all of the docking ports are the same height. Put differing modules on the scaffolding.
[This tutorial](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/48876-The-art-of-modular-base-building) has a lot of good advice.
